title: D.C. bus systems with maximum power point tracking (MPPT) regulators
fullText:
The number of modules required for a PV array where this is the sole energy source can be calculated from Equation 3.4.3.10(2) for systems containing regulators with maximum power point tracking:
 
Np	=	
Etot × fo


where
 
Pmod ×
 
Htilt × ηpvss × s
 
. . . 3.4.3.10(2)
 










where
 
Np	=	number of parallel strings of modules in the array (rounded up to the next whole number), dimensionless
Etot	=	total design daily energy demand, in watt hours (Wh)
fo	=	oversupply co-efficient, dimensionless
Pmod	=	derated power output of a module, in watts (W)
Htilt	=	daily irradiation on the tilted plane, in peak sun hours
Ns	=	number of series connected modules per string (an integer)
ηpvss	=	efficiency of PV subsystem, dimensionless
=	ηpv-batt × ηreg × ηbatt



ηpv-batt	=	energy transmission efficiency from the photovoltaic array to the battery (i.e. from the effect of cable losses)
ηreg	=	the energy efficiency of the regulator
ηbatt	=	the energy efficiency (i.e. watt-hour efficiency) of the battery
